snippet: Pro forma Senate sessions present an unconstitutional interference with the president’s irreducible power and duty.
abstract: Op-Ed article by law professor Laurence H Tribe asserts that Pres Obama's decision to use his power to make recess appointments despite the fact that the Senate was technically in session is constitutional; argues that preserving the authority the president needs to carry out his duties is the Constitution's clear command.
lead_paragraph: Pro forma Senate sessions present an unconstitutional interference with the president’s irreducible power and duty.
